steps.title: Welcome to the Federation
steps.content:
You are now a Junior Engineer for the Galactic Trade Federation.

Your mission: Build the Market Microservice that powers the economy of the Nebula Nexus universe.

What is a Microservice?
It's a small, independent program that does ONE thing very well.
Our service will:
  • Calculate commodity prices
  • Manage supply and demand
  • Handle player trades

steps.title: Create Project Structure
steps.content:
Open your terminal and create these folders:

mkdir "c:\Game Concept"
cd "c:\Game Concept"
mkdir src\services
mkdir src\config
mkdir src\utils
mkdir data\market-history
mkdir docs\lessons

Your structure should look like this:

steps.title: Create Package.json
steps.content:
Create a new file called package.json in the root (c:\Game Concept\):

{ "name": "nebula-nexus-market-service", "version": "1.0.0", "description": "Federation Market Price Microservice", "main": "market-service.js", "scripts": { "start": "node market-service.js", "test": "node test-time.js" }, "keywords": ["microservice", "market", "game"], "author": "", "license": "ISC" }

Why no npm packages? We're using only Node.js built-in modules. This keeps it lightweight, secure, and simple!

steps.title: Verify Your Setup
steps.content:
Check that everything is in place:

dir src /s

You should see all your folders listed.

If folders don't appear, check that you're in the right directory (c:\Game Concept)
